title.narrative: Bashiqa: Support for returnees through health and MHPSS

description.narrative:
Long-term objectives: Provide essential health care services to people in priority locations Reach as many people in need as possible across Iraq by securing safe access to front-line and newly retaken areas and continuing to provide sequenced assistance packages to people in acute need regardless of their location.
Short-term objectives: 120,000 crisis affected returnees residing in newly liberated areas of Baashiqa in Ninewa plain, with destruction rate of 50% of the infrastructure are provided with Health services advocating for additional safe, dignified and voluntary returns. WHY THIS BIG NUMBER? advocating for additional safe, dignified and voluntary returns. Is this not a separate short-term objective? The short-term objective is than: the health services will encourage people to return. (it is however hardly measurable, but good to mention).

Support returnees in Bashiqa sub-district on Ninawa Plains through healthcare with special attention for Mental Health and Psycho Social Support (MHPSS), and Sexual and Gender Based Violence (SGBV). The targeted villages are in the periphery and are so far not supported. Bashiqa population consists mostly of Yezidi returnees who suffered greatly from the atrocities of ISIS. Hence the attention for MHPSS and SGBV. Two strategic considerations: 1. This project is connected through joint activities on the ground with another Cordaid project from the HAU in the same subdistrict. 2. Both projects in Bashiqa are important for the track record in our dialogue with different donors (Dutch MFA) who support “return in the region”.

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH
